Tucson could smell the sulfur around him.  With senses twice as strong due =
to the compensation for his sight, the smell would prove over powering to a=
 bot such as himself, yet, through the stench, his determination wins over =
replusion, and presses on, slowly so is not to injure Rodimus, and attempt =
a safe rescue.  He also keeps in touch with Lord Elder and Perceptor.

"Lor=
d Elder, Perceptor, I want you to know that if you were to chose between sa=
ving your own life, and the lives of your comrades, you would probably want=
 to save your comrades instead of yourselves.  The compassion for a comrade=
 has far out powered my better judgement for survival.  I can not deny what=
 my heart spark tells me.  And it has told me that there is no greater powe=
r than that which is held by all Autobots and Maximals a like.  Rat Trap, I=
 hear you too, I know this is upsetting you greatly, and if you had not ext=
ended your own heart spark to help me the first time, I would not have made=
 it this far.  All of you who worry for me, take heart, I've been through w=
orse.  And please, understand that I failed Rodimus once, I will not fail h=
im a second time."

He transforms to robot mode, as he gets extremely close=
 to Rodimus, so is not to cause too much damage due to the force of tires h=
itting the ground.  He attempts to clear the rubble around him gently, and =
slowly with his hands.  As dark as it was, it appeared as if some light was=
 not shining through.  He stops for a moment, and now sees blurry objects b=
ecomming more focused as the area around him becomes visible.  Again the po=
wer of the Matrix within him, could sense that he would need his eyes once =
again.  He closes them for a moment, and re opens them able to see everythi=
ng clearly.

" By the Matrix..  Lord Elder, Legacy, Perceptor, I've got my =
vision back.  I can now see everything around me clearly.  Now, I can also =
hear Rodimus on the other end.  I'm attempting to get through the rubble, b=
ut it may take a moment or so to do it."

As he continues to dig, he keeps =
an ear out for Rodimus.

"Rodimus, if you can hear me, I need you to follow=
 my voice and dig through the rubble on your end, to meet up with me.  I've=
 got my vision back and I am now fully capable of getting us both out of he=
re safely.  Please, respond."

For Tucson Prime, it would be all or nothing=
.  If he couldn't get Rodimus out safely, he too, would remain behind to be=
 burried beneath the rubble.

Outside, Night Shift swallows hard as does Ra=
t Trap who has his tail firmly in his hands in a tense posture.  Quick Stri=
de's ears are forward, as he too appears nervous.

" That's Tucson for ya, =
Just like Optimus Prime.  Optimus would've done the same thing, gone right =
back in ta get his man outa there alive."

Rat Trap looks to Night Shift.

=
" Well, they are related.  Like Ancestor, like predascessor.  And Optimus P=
rime always came outa tough situations in one piece.  I just hope Wheels ca=
n too."

Quickstride paws the ground nervously.

" Then again, I dunno if O=
ptimus ever had ta storm Hydras' fortress ta get his comrades outa danger. =
 This is a new challenge in Autobot History. But we gotta believe that Tucs=
on Prime will make history when he gets Rodimus prime out of there in one p=
iece."

Night Shift and Rat Trap nodd.

" That's a good hope ta have Quicks=
tride.  We gotta believe in Tucson, guys.  That's our greatest power, belie=
ve in our allies and our friends.  Somethn' Hydras doesn't usually practice=
."

Night Shift turns to Legacy.

" Belief is all we got gon' for us now Le=
gacy.  We gotta hold onta that."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Ca=
rroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> Who: LEGACY, Rat Trap, Tuscon, Quickst=
ride, Kup
> Location: Area outside of the Black Fortress

rd Elder, This is Rat Trap, Wheels was commn' out with the others, but Rodi=
mus told 'em ta go, he did, but he just turned around and now he's gon' bac=
k in for Rodimus! I dunno if he's gonna be able ta come out in one piece!"
=
> 
> Lord Elder's voice came back on the same channel, "What?!?" Elder
> pa=
used, obviously taking a moment to digest what had been sent to him
> in a =
few short words. "Rodimus told him to go back? Where is Rodimus
> now, and =
where is Tuscon?"
> 
> "Tuscon?" Elder said, trying to contact Tuscon direc=
tly, although Rat
> Trap could probably hear it as well, "What is your situ=
ation?"
> 
> > Inside, Tucson's many wheels turn rapidly as he tries to rea=
ch Rodimus. Because of his failure two years past, he tries to redeem himse=
lf by actually succeeding in bringing out his comrade alive. He knew the at=
tempt could endanger his life as well, but by Primus he had to try. He soun=
ds his horn three more times, hoping that Rodimus would hear him.
> 
> Tusc=
on is quickly able to reach the wall of debris that stood between
> him and=
 Rodimus. The wall looked to be quite thick and impenetrable,
> however not=
 as impenetrable as it had before Tuscon had left the first
> time.
> 
> Di=
rt and stone and even bits of plant matter still filled the
> entrance, but=
 it is obvious that the previous explosion had weakened
> the slide of debr=
is in several places. The smell of sulfur was in the
> air, obviously comin=
g from the other side of the slide.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Meanwhile . . .
> 
> Wh=
o: CYCLONUS, Hydras
> Location: Black Fortress - Throne Room
> 
> The door =
to the throne room was flung open, and there standing in the
> doorway was =
the dirty and dented form of Cyclonus. He was covered from
> nearly head to=
 toe in dirt, soil and other bits of immediately
> unidentifiable matter.
>=
 
> "Hydras!" Cyclonus said as he spotted his commander and sprang into
> t=
he room. "What has happened?" Cyclonus attempted to grab his scanner
> and =
then realized that he had lost it somewhere. He glanced around for
> a mome=
nt and then grabbed one from near the throne and began running
> over Hydra=
s, "Are you okay?"
